text:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
There isn't enough rice, so its importation is permitted whereas the importation of cement is.............
explanation:
permitted; authorize or allow (something)
prohibited; that has been forbidden; banned.

text:

text:

The government has imposed an..................on the importation of used vehicles.
explanation:

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
The corpse has been taken to the ...................
explanation:
The corpse has been taken to themortuary
mortuary; a room or building in which dead bodies are kept, for hygienic storage or for examination, until burial or cremation.

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
In spite of the vicissitudes of life, she never........... from her plan
explanation:
The word that best completes the sentence is:
C. deviated
So, the completed sentence is:
"In spite of the vicissitudes of life, she neverdeviatedfrom her plan."
This means that despite the difficulties that life posed, she did not stray away from her plan.  Deviated means to stray or move away from a set course or plan, therefore C. Deviated is the correct answer.

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
When the solicitor told Awa to wait outside, she considered it ............to her dignity
explanation: In the context of the sentence, the phrase "considered it ... to her dignity" suggests that Awa perceived the solicitor's action as something offensive or disrespectful to her dignity. The word that aligns with this meaning is "an affront" (Option B). An affront refers to an action or remark that causes offence or disrespect. Therefore, Awa considered waiting outside as an affront to her dignity, indicating that she found it disrespectful or offensive.

text:

explanation: click here

text:

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
His appointment was................because of irregularities in his credentials.
explanation: "Annulled" specifically refers to cancelling or invalidating something, often due to legal or procedural reasons. In the context of the sentence, it implies that the appointment was declared null and void because of irregularities in the credentials.

text:

text:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.

options.A: I have not left the country and nothing will make me leave
options.B: I wanted to leave the country and I did
options.C: I will definitely leave the country one day
options.D: I would have liked to leave the country but I wasn't able to

explanation: He didn't leave the country because it was impossible

text:

text:

text:

text:

The family..............dinner when we knocked at the door.
explanation:

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
All................the president said was reported in the dailies.
explanation:
Allthatthe president said was reported in the dailies.
''That'' is correct because ''allwhat'' is always wrong, and you should use either ''allthat'' (or everything that, the words that, etc) or what. ''That'' is a relative pronoun like who/whom, whereas ''what'' is a nominal relative pronoun. The two words fulfill distinct grammatical parts, and cannot be interchanged

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
Which of the two questions is..................?
explanation:
Which of the two questions ismore difficult?
The rule is simple and has no exceptions. If you're only comparing two things, use comparatives like more and easier. If you're comparingmorethan two, use superlatives like most and easiest

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
If it rains, the exhibition will be cancelled,.............?
explanation:
question tags turn a statement into a question. They are often used for checking information that we think we know is true.
Usually if the main clause is positive, the question tag is negative, and if the main clause is negative, it's positive. For example: You don't like me (positive), do you (negative)?
from the  statement  ''If it rains, the exhibition will be cancelled, (positive)  wont it? (negative).? The speaker is certain the event would be canceled if it rains, the ''wont it?'' tag is to confirm there are all on the same page.
Question tag is used whenwewant to check something is true, or invite people to agree with us.

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
The rent is too high;............,the house is not in a suitable location.
explanation:
The rent is too high;besidesthe house is not in a suitable location.
Besides; means in addition to; apart from.

text:

Its about time your brother.............some attention to his English
explanation:
Its about time your brotherpaidsome attention to his English.
Paid; is the past and past participle of pay. In this context it means to give (attention, respect, or a compliment) to (someone or something).

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
The ________ toys have all been stolen.
explanation:
Thechildren'stoys have all been stolen.
The correct answer is children's. Children is the plural of child. The same applies to women's; people's; men's. You would never write, “The childs' toy”, as “child” is singular, so the apostrophe would come before the s, “the child's toy”.

text:

The ...............toys have all been stolen.
explanation:
The children'stoys have all been stolen.
The correct answer ischildren's. Children is the plural of child. The same applies to women's; people's; men's. You would never write, “The childs' toy”, as “child” is singular, so the apostrophe would come before the s, “the child's toy”.

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
The referee contemplated............the players off the pitch.
explanation:
The referee contemplatedsendingthe players off the pitch.
The verb "contemplated" is usually followed by a gerund (the -ing form of the verb), not an infinitive. So, after "contemplated", the correct form is "sending".

text: In question numbered 78 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Excursion; a short journey or trip, especially one taken as a leisure activity.

explanation: Heat; high temperature.

explanation: Bellows; a device with an air bag that emits a stream of air when squeezed together with two handles, used for blowing air into a fire.

explanation: In blacksmithing, tongs are the correct tool used to grip and lift hot metal from the fire.

text: In question numbered 87 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Bowl; a round, deep dish or basin used for food or liquid.

text: In question numbered 88 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Habitat; the natural home or environment of an animal, plant, or other organism.

text: In question numbered 89 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Damage; physical harm that impairs the value, usefulness, or normal function of something.

text: In question numbered 90 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Specie; a group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding.

text: In question numbered 91 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
